website_summaries.verdict: This inexpensive rubber groomer massages your dog while effectively removing loose hair and adding shine to his coat.
pros: Can be used dry or in the bath w/shampoo
Massage in a circular motion to attract and remove loose hair
cons: Won't break up mats or tangles

customer_reviews.title: Pit friendly!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 pitbulls they all loved the feel of this product, I will admit most of the hair doesn't stay on this but I just sweep it up at the end, I have 2 pits that have a rougher coat and 1 that was a very fine silky coat, works wonders on the 2 with the rougher coat, didn't get the same result with the silkier coat, but that could be she doesn't shed as much as them, not really sure. But over all I'm happy with the results and would definitely recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah G.

customer_reviews.title: The BEST grooming/shedding tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have two labs that shed year round but now that it's summer they are REALLY shedding. Especially my 13 year old yellow one. Regular brushing did not help with her short hair. And the poor dog was so hot with all the extra fur just hanging around. This did the trick! It took a whole other dog worth of hair off of her. The hairs either stuck to the brush or, or sat on top of her to be easily brushed off with your hand. The hairs that were in the brush fell out of the brush easily when it was tapped on the floor. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: sugarrush313

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe, but this brush works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!! First try, within a few seconds of brushing I was able to collect a handful of fur. This is more than I expected. The best groom brush ever created!!!
customer_reviews.author: CeciL

customer_reviews.title: I can't say enough good things!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is a Godsend for people who own shorthair breeds. I have a Weimaraner who is having her first she'd ever and it is awful. I tried the Furminator but I felt like it was uncomfortable to use on my dogs short hair. I bought the Zoom Groom after recommendations from fellow weim owners. I opened it and after just ONE run down her back tons of hair came off! I used this on her during her bath with deshedding shampoo and also brush her down with it when she is dry. Works like a charm! I'm happy with the size, material, and durability of the Zoom Groom.
customer_reviews.author: TyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous grooming tool for short haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: This arrived today and I spent 40 minutes grooming my short haired basset mix and he was in heaven!!! He would not tolerate the wire brushes at all but he lay down and nudged my hand for more with the kong!! The hair comes out fabulously whether you use a circlular motion or simply groom in straight lines. I did find that the hair doesn't it collect in the brush at all so my floor was a mess I purchased a pink and a blue thinking one was firmer than the other but they are both the same firmness and anyone who tells you one is harder than the other is kidding themselves.
customer_reviews.author: TRACY

customer_reviews.title: My go-to grooming tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool! I have two lab mixes and they SHED. I use this outside and can brush them for 20 minutes each day for three days and still pull fur off! The local birds love us in the winter! My dogs don't tolerate slicker brushes, but love how this one feels. When I asked if they want to get brushed they come running over and just sit down, then move around to get to different spots. I get tufts out easily and works both layers of their coat. My dad stole my first one for his GSD/lab mix and loves it. Zoom groom is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Never stops finding loose hair
customer_reviews.text: Well made, meant for smaller hands. Bigger hands may have issues holding it as intended. I have a Soluki-Husky and I find straight strokes work best. The circular motion was difficult. I also use this item with Burts bees dry shampoo and it works terrific. At first because of the material it is made of my dog thought it was a toy, as soon as i started to use it on her she just went limp and said go to town. She does not look to play with it any longer, was worried she would chew it up.
customer_reviews.author: Droned2

customer_reviews.title: it's amazing and b) it is amazing for dogs of any ...
customer_reviews.text: I now have five of these lol. I do in-home dog rescue and currently have 16 dogs here. The two uses I have found for this that make it indispensible for me are a) it is a hair magnet on short-haired dogs - man, it's amazing and b) it is amazing for dogs of any length coat when you are giving them a bath. Love it and can't recommend it highly enough. One thing, make sure you keep it put up, because dogs think it's pretty awesome as a chew toy lol
customer_reviews.author: WholisticMom

customer_reviews.title: We're working on it
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure my newly adopted dog would enjoy being brushed if she could stop trying to chew on this brush like a Kong toy. When she is napping, I can gently brush her with this easy-to-hold comb, and the shed hair just comes out in clumps. It works very well. When she realizes what I am doing, she's trying to eat it! That's not the comb's fault, though. I think this is a great value grooming item and I hope we will be able to really use it one of these days.
customer_reviews.author: R. E. Pope

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a short haired dog and I didn't realize the amount of hair they shed. I tried another rubber brush for my Great Dane and it didn't really help all that much. I saw this brush and I was a bit skeptical because the bristles are so far apart and think but it actually works amazing! The hair clings to it almost like it's static. It brushes him really well and he likes the way it feels. I would purchase this again and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kotch

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it - works great
customer_reviews.text: This brush is fabulous. I use it on my German Shepherds and they absolutely love it and lay still (a rarity for one in particular ;) for me to brush them. It does well as grabbing loose hairs. The only thing I don't like is that it doesn't always pulls the hairs off the dog, so I have to do a last go over with another brush or there are just piles of hair on them. But honestly, it does so well at gathering the hair that it's no big deal, and I still definitely recommend the brush
customer_reviews.author: HopeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, would buy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this brush to bathe my lab. As he has oily coat and is hard for the soap to penetrate his coat. This made me use less shampoo on him as the brush helped lather in the shampoo as well as remove loose hair. He loves the feeling as well as is a soft rubber. U can also use this as a regular brush to remove loose hair. It pulls it out but won't hang on to it. So make sure u do it outside, where the hairs won't get everywhere. Great Product, would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Geovany O.

customer_reviews.title: Their favorite brush, by far
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who came up with the design (my mom says someone must have been drunk and trying to brush their pet with a box of crayons) but my cats and dogs all LOVE it. Even the ones who don't usually like to be brushed will rush up and beg to be brushed when they see this in my hand. I have one dog with very short hair and it doesn't pick up/collect/form a mat of her hair like it's supposed to, but she loves it so much, I'm not going to complain about that. Buy a few and keep them in various places - your pets and your couch cushions will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Do not do the up sneak

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe how effective this thing is. I use in conjunction with a Furminator brush.
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how effective this thing is. My dog is a serious shedder and this helps keep the amount of hair deposited indoors to a manageable level. I use it in conjunction with a Furminator every single morning. It can be quite vigorous so I keep the pressure light and let it do its own work. About every week I give it a light wash with mild detergent and warm water in order to remove the oil and reestablish the tackiness of the silicon.
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for our Pit Bull/Boxer mix. Her short hair was getting all over our house and the slicker brush we have did nothing to help. This is the ticket! It really, really works for the short hairs! If you have trouble getting the little hairs out of the brush, just blow on it - it puffs the hair right out (but do this outside because it's messy). I also use this on a long-haired Basset Hound mix that we are watching and it is equally as effective. It works wonders. The dogs love it because it feels good. Just rub it all over them vigorously, in a circular motion.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hutchins

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Long Human!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guy with long hair. I have a 5 x 5 foot rug in my room. It's a dark color so i didn't think there was any hair on it. I recently discovered I was wrong. I searched around for a hair picker-upper and saw some reviews that suggested this KONG ZoomGroom. It did not disappoint. PROS: * It does pick up hair like a magnet, which allows you to easily collect it. CONS: * Small size requires you to bend over a lot. Thus, for large surface areas I suggest using a chair or stool and do the work in sections. I 100% recommend this product for picking up long human from carpets or rugs!
customer_reviews.author: J. Juarez

customer_reviews.title: They work great, and don't bother the dogs like some other ...
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Zoom Grooms for almost 8 years now. They work great, and don't bother the dogs like some other effective dog brushes. With 30 - 60 minutes of use per week (we have 2 labs), the ends of the "teeth" wear down after 2 - 3 years. This does not make it useless, but not as effective. Please note this is ideal for over-coat, and does not remove under-coat as well.
customer_reviews.author: RAD Resort

customer_reviews.title: I have found the best price to be on amazon
customer_reviews.text: This must be my 5th Kong Zoom Groom all because of my fault. I have 2 pitbull type dogs who shed tremendously. I use the Zoom Groom in an 8 pattern to really agitate and remove loose or soon to be loose hair before they end up on my furniture, clothes, floor or food. This is a rubber material and I have made the mistake of leaving it damp / wet/ outside which causes it to develop black marks that dont come off with boiling water, bleach or other cleaning agents. I have found the best price to be on amazon. I have owned it in red and blue and dont see a difference in material. Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: I can finally brush my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a short coat, no under coat and itchy, troubled skin. We've finally hit on a diet and treatment (he had chronic yeast skin infection) that works, but now that the tratment is working he is shedding fur and dander like a madman. Every other brush hurt his tender skin and made him run for the hills. No amount of treats, etc would make him allow brushing. This brush he allowed-tentatively at first- then enthusiastically. His short coat now gleams and the shedding is under control. Love this brush. Going to give one to any one who gets a new puppy or dog.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lake

customer_reviews.title: I have a chocolate lab and he is shedding like crazy right now
customer_reviews.text: I have a chocolate lab and he is shedding like crazy right now. He LOVES this brush, and I am moderately impressed with how well it does in the bath with shampoo. On a dry coat, it doesn't do much at all, it took some of the loose top coat off, but did absolutely nothing for his undercoat. I still use it though, because my lab loves the way it feels. The best thing I found for getting the undercoat is the Furminator, that thing does an amazing job, though my lab hates it. I use the ZoomGroom in between strokes of the Furminator; it takes a while, but doing it this way keeps my pup happy.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Labradors!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Labrador and own a Furbinator®. This is a nice brush to own as well, because unlike the Furbinator, you can repeatedly brush without hurting the dog. This has more of a soft, silicone nub rather than wiry bristles. With our Lab, you can seriously sit there and brush for half an hour and the fur will just keep flying - especially in molting season. That's where this brush comes in! LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Deenie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, dog not crazy about it
customer_reviews.text: I have a boxer who sheds a lot. The first time I used this on him I got piles of hair off of him. It works really well, though he's not crazy about it. I think he would rather it be a chew toy. Side note: I have a second one of these that I use to pull hair up off the carpets in my car and it works really well for that too :)
customer_reviews.author: tdg119

customer_reviews.title: This is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A brush that I don't have to pick the fur out of the bristles so that I can continue brushing. I have a Great Dane and he sheds moderately. His fur isn't thick so you have to be careful as to what kind of bristles you're using. He was always good about standing still with what I used previously, but, with this he looks like he's enjoying the heck out of his grooming session. It really does a great job of getting that "undercoat" I do not use this indoors because the hair seems to literally fly off of him. Really happy that I was told about this brush.
customer_reviews.author: Beegz wife

customer_reviews.title: He sheds like crazy and this brush really grabs onto the hair
customer_reviews.text: This works really well on my pug/beagle mix and his thick pug coat. He sheds like crazy and this brush really grabs onto the hair. I got the large size and it fits well in my hand and isn't too big for him. However, it doesn't work quite as well on my boxer and his fine, short coat. It will help some, but I find the fine toothed combs work better on my boxer. Overall, I like this brush. It's easy to use and serve its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Brush for Short-Haired Dogs
customer_reviews.text: If you have a short-haired dog, GET THIS BRUSH. We have a Vizsla, and he sheds like crazy, but no other brush we tried would get any significant amount of hair off of him. (We have tried, wire brushes, bristle brushes, furminators, EVERYTHING.) This is the only brush that works. Because it's rubber, the brush "fingers" do get worn down over time (a couple years maybe), but this brush is cheap enough that replacing every few years is totally reasonable. We also use this on our beagle and it works for him, too!
customer_reviews.author: Blondie

customer_reviews.title: finally!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush works on lab hair. I've tried everything from furminator to slickers to pin brushes to shedding blades to boar bristle brushes. None of them removed much of the loose hair at all from my two labs. After three years of daily vacuuming, I am so ready for a grooming tool that removes the dead hair. Thanks, Kong!! My vacuum may get a rest now. I can hope.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Great for short coats
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Dane and she has very short fur. We already had other brushes for our other dogs with more of a lab like fur coat but those brushes didn’t do anything for our Dane. My sisters are dog groomers and recommended this brush. I was somewhat skeptical but ordered one anyways. I should have known to trust the professionals. This brush is great. It works really well on her short fur. It also works both wet and dry so it’s a great tool for bath time. I haven’t tried this yet on my longer coat dog but I can imagine it would be useful for him too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole DTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a toy
customer_reviews.text: The Kong is a great brush to use and it works fine. The only problem I had was not telling my Labradane that it was not a toy. Before I realized my mistake Jackson had chewed one end of it off. No problem as I was able to glue the separated piece back on and the brush is almost as good as new. It does what it says it will do and it is easy to brush a big and goofy Labradane. It is well worth the purchase. Have a great day and may the LOVE of JESUS CHRIST richly bless you. Charles(NAHUM 1:7 / JOHN 3:16 KJV).
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Charles D. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while, use it everyday for my two domestic short hair cats and no more hairballs. They love it too. Our routine is to give them cat nip or a cat nip toy and brush them for a few minutes. Initially we brushed off tons of hair, but now that we use it pretty much daily, we only get a little. This was the key to eliminating our hairball problem.
customer_reviews.author: SunsetGirl

customer_reviews.title: Best brush ever!
customer_reviews.text: A couple months ago, we went to the groomer to get our dogs' nails trimmed. We discussed our dog with a thick undercoat and how we can never seem to get her to stop shedding. They suggested this brush, and I'm so glad we tried it out. Our dog's love getting brushed because the bristles are soft. I can sit for a 5 minute brushing session and get so much hair off of our Rosie. This brush does wonders, and it's so inexpensive. Take the plunge! Buy this brush!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Marks

customer_reviews.title: Best brush ever!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this I literally just got it and I love the it already. I have a lean mean shedding machine boxer. It is hard to keep hair out of the house well no more I brushed her for 15 minutes and got this much hair off I was amazed. I love that it is rubber I had a medall dog comb but it broke my baby out so I was stuck with hair everywhere .I was hopeless.then I was on social media and saw a professional groomer using and said it worked wonders for their short hair dogs.so I was like why not we’ll turns out to be the best 14 dollars I ever spent thank you zoom groom
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Best washing and massaging brush to keep your Bestest-Buddy soft and clean for several days!!
customer_reviews.text: We get these at our local pet wash and I had to have one because of how awesome they are! When I wash the dog I am no longer breaking my wonderful manicures, definitely a PLUS! :) It gets all the loose hairs so they don't go down the drain (not that our dog has super long hair but med length) I can easily remove the unwanted hair off and throw it away. Its soft manageable material, so it doesn't hurt him when I scrub hard, it dries quickly after getting wet, and I can easily store it away with my Dog-Bath gear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Lover Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have a pitbull and this is the Best. Brush. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pitbull and I've purchased and tried 4 different brushes but for some reason I could never get a majority of his loose hairs out, I felt like they would just get pushed around. Looked up some forums and videos about suggested brushes for pits and kept coming across this style(curry) brush and this specific brush kept getting mentioned as well. Tried it on my dog once I got it and I've never seen so much hair come off my dog with ANY of my other brushes. I was so happy with the results and recommend this to everyone with a short coat like pitts have.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Works but needs a handle
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I would like a little bit bigger and with a strap on the back like a curry comb/brush. I brush my black Lab outside and I keep flinging it across the yard because I have nothing to hold on to.. I use it, then the tool that thins his hair and finish up with the curry comb. It's quite a bit of work and having to go pick up the zoomgroom repeatedly does get annoying and add on time to the process.
customer_reviews.author: Yokie

customer_reviews.title: KING ZoomGroom has become our new GO-TO "brush".
customer_reviews.text: This has become our new GO-TO "brush". One of our dogs have sensitive skin and the Furminator is way too rough. We now use the ZoomGroom to brush our dogs a couple times a week, and also to really get in there and scrub during baths! We were skeptical at first because well, it's not an actual "brush". But, it really gets the job done, perhaps even better than a conventional brush. Now keep in mind, it will not remove as much hair because it's not "cutting" away any good hair, it's only pulling out the dead hair that was going to fall all over your precious home lol. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppy shedding!
customer_reviews.text: After hearing that metal bristle brushes can damage and pull out healthy fur, I looked into other grooming alternatives. I have a shiba who is blowing her puppy coat and this collects hair I didn't know she had! It's a rubbery, silicone-y material reminiscent of her Kongs so she does chew on it if I leave it handy/while I'm brushing her, but man does it collect hair! The collected fur comes off so easily, maybe even a little too easily as it slides off from the motion of lifting the brush when I go for another stroke, but that's a weakness I'll take. I have not tried it on wet fur or for shampooing just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Karina Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Shedders dream come true!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy sheds so bad and no other brush ever takes hair off of her, I was feeling so discouraged until I read about the zoom groom. I hoped it would work but was blown away by how well and quickly it took handfuls of hair off of my pup. It just comes right out, it's incredible! I am finally seeing the light at the end of our hairy tunnel. Thank you KONG! This picture was taken after just a minute of playing around with the brush when I first got it. I later did a full brushing and got even more!
customer_reviews.author: MandJ

customer_reviews.title: Just freaking get the thing!!! THIS IS THE ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for deshedding. This is a honest review. I purchased the furminator and the Kong zoom groom at the same time to see which one works best for my dog and let me tell u they u. They both work but the furminator doesn't pull off much hair like the zoom groom this thing is amazing I will post a pic and video of my first use results
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great brush
customer_reviews.text: One of the best dog brushes on the market, super easy to use & if you have a seasonal shedding dog this is great to help in assisting the blowout & my dog loves it, all I have to do is show her the brush & say “let’s go brush” & she jumps up on the space I have set up for her brushing & she seems to enjoy the brushing
customer_reviews.author: Avocado Queen

customer_reviews.title: Good grooming brush, bad toy
customer_reviews.text: I like this product for it being easy to grab during my puppy's bath time and to scrub him better than my bare hands(don't want to hurt him accidentally with my nails so can't clean him very well) , it scrub loose hair out very well. The color also allows me to find it in a mess very quickly. BUT I don't like it as a toy for my puppy...according to product detail it can be a toy for dogs so I let him play with it after bath; however, I soon found him chewing/breaking the brush, almost swallowed the plastic bits. So I definitely recommend ZoomGroom for brushing and bathing but not a suitable toy for medium size chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon K

customer_reviews.title: Effective brush for short-haired dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This brush works great for our two short-haired rescue dogs (one with a very short pit bull coat and one with a slightly longer, more lab-like coat)! We use it during shedding season(s) and it minimizes the amount of hair that ends up on our floors. It is easy to use (I make many gentle circles with it as well as brush in the direction of fur growth) and extremely easy to clean which is great for someone who is particular about cleanliness of grooming tools like myself. Make sure it is out of reach of playful dogs, though, as it is similar in texture and size to chew toys and can be tempting for them to grab!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Knowles

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for de-sheding
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my great dane who has short hair. surprisingly she sheds A LOT! I run this through her coat a few times before i give her a bath and all the hair comes right out. She also loves the way it feels! I also use it when bathing her but i dont think it makes that big of a difference. I will definitely keep using it! I like it MUCH better than the furminator. I bought both because I couldnt decide which to go with and the furminator was just too abrasive for Bella she would run when I tried to brush her with it
customer_reviews.author: Megvp

customer_reviews.title: Best Brush!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing, a friend recommended the ZoomGroom to me and I have not regretted my purchase. Been using it for over five months and it is holding up perfectly. The ZoomGroom does it's job while giving my dogs a massage. Love the fact that it is rubber, makes it easy to clean when needed and it is also very gentle on their coat and skin. I foster dogs, so have had the opportunity to use it many different coat types and it works great for everyone. When I pull out the ZoomGroom everyone gets super excited. My dogs and I approve, and I would recommend this brush.
customer_reviews.author: QuillPrime

customer_reviews.title: Get a silky smooth pitbull with this brush!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a amstaff and I brush him almost every day to keep his coat soft and shiny. I had been using a regular soft bristle brush for him and although brushing him was a time consuming task i did it. Today I received this brush and after just a few minutes I had a huge pile of hair (which I never have had before) and my pup felt like silk!! Definitely recommend for anyone who has a short haired dog. I was skeptical about it working but it really does its job! I'm so happy I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel petznik

customer_reviews.title: Best brush for short haired pups!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is great! My pit sheds worse than any other dog/cat that I have ever had!! Clean bill of health, he just sheds A LOT. This brush was recommended on another site so I ordered it immediately. His picky tail hasn't liked any of the other brushes I have tried, but he LOVES this one and it works great! I couldn't believe how much hair came off this dog the first time I brushed him. As a bonus, it works great on cats too. My cat loves it. 😉 I highly recommend this brush if you have a short haired shedder.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Mechelle

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap! This thing is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My Manchester Terrier has short wiry fur and sheds like crazy. I’ve tried both curry and boar bristle brushes as well as a super expensive de-shedding tool, none of which did anything. This thing worked like magic! It didn’t hold onto her fur like the pictures show, since you use it in a circular motion her hair flew everywhere and made a mess, but it removed a ton of hair. And my dog loved it so much she came back for more. I never write reviews, mostly because I’m lazy, but this thing earned my praise.
customer_reviews.author: SadieB

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best dog grooming brush I have experienced thusfar. So simple and yet so effective. I have also used it on my short haired cat with great results - never thought my cat had so much hair. She feels so sleek and smooth now. My two Corgi dogs' hair comes out in handfulls and they have long and thick hair. The dogs love it and indicate, in their voices, that they want more. They turn their bodies around, I guess to make sure I have gotten it all!! Heh! Heh! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MarleneLouiseTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Carries too much static electricity; arrived dirty
customer_reviews.text: The brush I received was "new in packaging" but somehow very dirty and dusty. This is SO STATICY on my labrador's coat that it will not work correctly; it just continues to shock my dog with static electricity. I've used curry combs on hoses that are similar to this, but those rubber curries did not carry static like this item does.
customer_reviews.author: TheCharlestonian

customer_reviews.title: Size listed is incorrect, but still a great brush.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love it, including Aussie mix who normally hates being brushed. Gets a lot of loose fur out, but doesn't pick it up very well, so it's better used outside with a slicker brush after to pick up all the loose pieces. Docked one star because the description is off. The size listed is "Large", but the packaging on the one I got is labeled "Small". The dimensions in the pictures (~4.5 inches long) are correct; I should have checked that before ordering instead of just assuming a large brush would be, well, larger.
customer_reviews.author: Inquisitor

customer_reviews.title: Great grooming product for dogs who shed!
customer_reviews.text: I first came across this product at a dog grooming store. When the store owner showed me how much hair I could brush off my dog BEFORE washing him, I was in love! I own a short haired pit and yet he manages to shed more than any pet I have ever owned! This is a great product for grooming. I use it before bathing and in between. The amount of shedding hair it removes is astonishing and I have noticed less hair around my home and clothes when used frequently. My dog also loves the way it feels when I brush him with it so he has no complaints either. :)
customer_reviews.author: Justbritttany

customer_reviews.title: Great for Smooth Coated Breeds!
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I've only used a few other brands of curry combs/brushes, but this is definitely my favorite one. It's fantastic for smooth-coated dogs like pit bulls, boxers, and great Danes, which do not have undercoats but still shed like crazy. It's also an effective deshedding tool to use in conjunction with combs like the the Furminator on short, double coats. Where the Furminator will help strip out the undercoat, the Zoom Groom will remove the loose top coat on Labs, shepherds, beagles, etc. that the Furminator won't get (that's not an insult to the Furminator, they're just designed for different purposes).
customer_reviews.author: Amber J Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt live without it. A great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic dog grooming tool!! I have a very heavy shedding chihuahua/beagle mix, and this brush really allows me to get lots and lots of the loose hairs off of her during our daily brushing sessions, rather than allowing them to fall off and stick to my furniture and clothing. This brush is also great for her particular straight/wiry/needle-like hair texture, and because she's quite sensitive and wont allow me to brush her with any other tool, but seems to enjoy the soft-ish plastic nubs of this brush. It really removes tons of hair..its quite shocking how much hair gets removed with this tool. Couldnt live without it. A great product!
customer_reviews.author: rosalyn

customer_reviews.title: Lovin this Brush!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you love your dog as much as I love my Meeka, this is definitely worth the money! I've used a rubber brush before and for the past year a grooming glove to help groom and bath my dog. Hands down the Kong ZoomGroom is the best by far. The grip is awesome and very comfortable not to mention how great it is at removing loose shedding hair. My dog is currently shedding and she has been leaving hair every where. After her bath today I could clearly see areas around her neck less hairy and I know she loves how it feels 🐶. I am extremely pleased with my purchase 😊.
customer_reviews.author: MED

customer_reviews.title: works wonders, taking so much hair off a short hair dog, even after a shower the night before.
customer_reviews.text: gently brushes the skin yet takes off so much undercoat that we didn't even know it was there! it's amazing! we were dubious about how the big loosely spread teeth will do the job. but it works like magic. we have a short hair dog, rhodesian ridgeback. her hair is so short, and we just showered her last night. but the brush got so much off her. making me feel bad of leaving all that extra hair on her. i got so much off her, i'm truly amazed. no wonder it gets the crazy reviews! highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie H.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Wonderful Kong
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this brush is great! I have 4 different brushes and none have done what Kong did in one brushing. My pit bull had very dried skin and losing small patches of hair. I was going nuts, washing putting oil on his skin and vushing. I bought Kong to give it a try, I now have used it for 2 wks twice daily and my boy Tiny stands and let's me brush. He won't move, I have to tell him that mommas done! The hair that comes out wow, I never knew and his skin is clearing up! We love kong!
customer_reviews.author: Terri McGlothin

customer_reviews.title: my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I like this brush but I wish I loved it. It really does get the hair out of my lab's coat, the only problem is that the hair flies all over instead of being held in the brush. My dog actually enjoys being brushed with his though, so it makes it worth it to have to collect the hair and vacuum afterwards. It could just be the type of hair that my dog has that the brush just can't collect it. It does the job of getting the hair off though. It's very rubbery and seems like it would feel good to a dog. I haven't tried it while bathing him yet but I will do that next.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Feels good in my hand and really grabs loose hair
customer_reviews.text: My dog sheds like that's his job. And he's damn good at his job. Bathing is the number one way I get rid of his hair and this thing just amazed me. It felt right in my hand, it had so many more contact points to help grab loose hair, and Baxter hated his bath a little less than usual this time. Or maybe that was just me.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W

customer_reviews.title: Maybe your dogs new favorite thing
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product and my dog loves it to boot. All I have to do is pick this up and my dog get happy and is ready for a good brushing. It seems like the fur never stops coming off him when using it, especially when he is blowing up his under coat. The rubber nubs give him a good massage and he practically preens while I bush him. When it gets a bit dirty or oily just a bit of dish soap and warm water makes it as good as new. Not sure when I'll be needing another one of these is it's so sturdy but I'll be getting a new one when that time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Jason R Walter

customer_reviews.title: Good - didn’t work exactly like I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: My dog who doesn’t like being brushed will let us use this on her. She hates a regular brush, and tolerates the furminator, but not for long. It doesn’t collect her hair in the knobs of the groomer, kind of just shoves it all together near her tail (very wiry short haired terrier mix), so I then have to kind of collect the hair in a wad. This is still better than sweeping it up off of every surface in my house, though. AND, our grooming averse cat tolerates it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: Great product for removing dead undercoat from smooth coat dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great product for removing dead undercoat from smooth coat dogs. It's a slightly softer material than most curry combs and grips the hair better. The only downside is after about 8 months the tips are peeling and beginning 2 come off. Not the whole tip, just little bits of silicon. It's still completely usable and probably will be for another couple of years. For the price, I would buy this product 4x a year if I had to
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Wow - best brush for my Pug
customer_reviews.text: My pug sheds way more than I anticipated and I went to petsmart and they told me to get a wooden bristle brush but it doesnt even compare to what this brush can do. Sooooo much hair comes off! i don;t know how it works since its an odd shape and weird rubber material, but I could brush him for hours and this thing would still get more hair out. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Great brush for dogs blowing out their coat
customer_reviews.text: Loved everything about this brush. My Golden isn’t just blowing out her coat but also has thyroid problems so she has LOTS of loose hair. I had tried countless brushes but none of them would get out all the loose hair. I noticed that this brush had great reviews so I gave it a shot and I’m so glad I did. Not only did this brush help with her excess hair, it was extremely easy to clean out. I 100% recommend this brush, especially for dogs who are blowing out their coat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great brush for epic shedding
customer_reviews.text: Best brush ever. My dog is a smooth-coated border collie who is blowing his fall coat. His shed fur is loose, light, and floaty, so it's literally wafting about my house, thumbing its nose at gravity. This brush does the best I've found at finding and gathering the loose hair. This particular animal usually jumps straight up in the air, executes a 360 spin, and flees from groom activities. He actually tolerates this brush. Be sure to brush outdoors, upwind - no matter how good a brush is, this kind of shed will still get all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Corgi friendly
customer_reviews.text: We have a Corgi and bought this because we had a groomer before we moved that recommended this. It works amazingly. There was SO much hair in the brush and it stayed in the brush instead of getting over the drain. Of course, a lot of hair was still covering the drain since he is a Corgi, but it helped a lot. Plus he loved the massage. This helped a lot with just getting a lot of his undercoat out and resulted in less shedding around the house. I used it with the deshedding shampoo by Furminator. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Dog tested, groomer approved.
customer_reviews.text: I love the ZoomGroom, I have been using them for 10 years as a professional groomer and they are so versatile and last so long. The soft rubber nubs are a gentle massage for dogs, especially if they are scared of groomings or brushings. This also makes a great shampoo scrubber for the bath. I scrub this over my short haired dog to make it rain hair and my long haired dog likes it as a massager.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: An absolute necessity for bathing my husky!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my ZoomGroom and never want to bathe my husky without it. I wet her fur, add some dog shampoo, and use the ZoomGroom to lather. It spreads the shampoo around, creates a nice lather, loosens the dirt, and cleans her fur really well.
customer_reviews.author: Live.Laugh.Love.

customer_reviews.title: Removes Loose Hair Like Magic
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it, so it must feel good to her. This brush pulls more hair than her other more conventional bristle brush. I don't know where all the loose hair is coming from, but it pulls hair out like magic, The only downside is the loose hair does not stay in the brush until you remove it. It floats into outer space on each stroke.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Such a great brush!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great s brush for my hound dog! He normally tries to take brushes away that he doesn’t like but he sits and enjoys it when I use this brush. It pulls the excess hair out gently and holds it to the brush with static I believe but then all you have to do to get the hair released from it is to blow it loose and it comes right off. I’m not sure how it would work on longer coats though?
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Scotto Rinaldi

customer_reviews.title: it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily when I'm giving my dogs a bath, to work the soap into their coats. For this, it works very well. I've tried to use it for just brushing, but it doesn't work well for that - I have a border collie and a border collie mix. It pulls out a little hair and is gentle, but it doesn't pull out as much hair as other brushes. But I bought it for bathing and for that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Impressed after all.
customer_reviews.text: This actually is a very good product and after my comparison to the furminator I previously had, this is just as good if not better as you are able to brush her very short chest hairs without hurting her. She has little short beagle-like or Lab-like hairs which most products aren’t great for. It seems to get a lot of the hairs out.
customer_reviews.author: Quacks

customer_reviews.title: Best Deshedding Tool
customer_reviews.text: Had this brush for almost 2 months now. It does a fantastic job removing the under coat. The only down side is it makes the hair static-y which then clings to me, her, and little flyaways drift around the air. Best to brush OUTSIDE. But I solved the static problem by dipping the brush in a bowl of water and then brushing and repeat as needed. This brush is so gentle my dog begs to keep being brushed. I'd recommend it to anyone with medium to short haired dogs & cats. (My cat also enjoys!) I also use it to remove hair from furniture, dog's bedding, and carpet. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brush for both grooming and bathing my puppy. It really works! Picks up so much hair it's incredible. After my puppys grooming and bathing, he won't shed for a couple days, so I'm sure if you use this brush on your dog everyday it will greatly minimize all the shedding! Feels great for my puppy too, you can tell he likes it cause he will look relaxed and blissful.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: so it's fine, and I like that there aren't bristles to ...
customer_reviews.text: For my two boxers, this brush doesn't do much more than I could do by running my hand back and forth through their hair. It was cheap, so it's fine, and I like that there aren't bristles to get totally clogged, but I don't think I'd buy it again. Maybe better for long haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: This really works great, especially for short haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: This really works great, especially for short haired dogs. We have an american bull dog and we tried the furamator first. It worked ok but it was hard to use, took forever and did not get as much hair. We switched to this and we probably got twice as much hair and it was much easier to use without hurting the dogs skin. If you have a short haired dog I would try this out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Dotson

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: You wanna take the hair off your dog, in a good way, then this is the product. It does things no other brush can do, NO LIE! Get it, you'll be extremely happy. It's the second one I bought. I have one myself and I just bought my sister one. She is amazed at how much hair it took off and also how much cleaner her house is because of how good of a job it does.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Capelli

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush!
customer_reviews.text: Used this on both of my chihuahuas and my German Shepherd- it worked great on both coat types. This thing really gets the hair coming off... It's crazy to watch the hair fall off, and yet just. keeps. going. Seriously, I never knew my dogs had so much hair in my life! As for the quality: very good! I don't have to worry about this thing wearing out. I ordered pink and I got a green brush. Not a big deal to me. Experience: the dogs seem to really enjoy it a lot more than other brushes. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: and I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an efficient brush to de-shed my 2 puggles forever. Nothing seemed to really get the undercoat out. I spent an entire day reading reviews for different brushes and decided to go with this one, and I'm so glad I did! It works! It really works!! I took the puggles outside and first brushed in a circular massage motion, then straight down their backs. I could have made them 2 more puggle buddies with the amount of hair that came off of them!! I've been trying to keep up with it once a week to spare my dark wood floors and couches from loose puggle hair. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Miss meliss

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend to let your dog chew this.
customer_reviews.text: Even though this also says "toy" I do not recommend that you let your dog chew it. I have a 11 lb. mini dachshund and within 30 minute of opening the package, after brushing him for a little, he decided to chew on the toy. I checked on him 10 minutes later and he already chewed a chunk off of the toy/brush. I would have expected a KONG product to be more durable and chew resistant, just like their other KONG toys...
customer_reviews.author: shoppingjen

customer_reviews.title: Works great wet or dry
customer_reviews.text: I use this brush while shampooing my dog or just grooming him while dry. It does a great job gently raking the loose hair out of his coat. I also have a standard metal grooming brush that pulls or tugs out a few more hairs. The brush is like a big eraser, it's not too soft or hard. My dog doesn't seem to mind it at all. The only caution is that it can get statically charged if it's really dry out, something to consider. If you're using it for his bath then scrub away, the hairs get collected in the nubs so you just pull them off in one big mat and into the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: WillwonderTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not for German Shepherd Dog's
customer_reviews.text: Did not work on German Shepherd Dog fur. I can get more fur off petting her. Seriously, I was surprised at how it didn't catch any fur and I'm talking top coat, not under coat. I bought based on other GSD owners reviews. I gave it away to an owner of a Blue Tick hound and Doberman. Side note: None of the dogs liked getting brushed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mini

customer_reviews.title: the shape makes it easy to grasp and hold while using and the amount ...
customer_reviews.text: the shape makes it easy to grasp and hold while using and the amount of loose hair it combs out is amazing! My dogs had just been to the groomers and there was a lot of hair combed out! Both of my boxers love this used on them - they're shinny & soft and will stand still forever if you're using this on them. Best of all, when it's not being used as a brush, my male loves to play with it! It's like a heavy duty chew toy - he loves to carry it around all day & it doesn't look worse for ware. Just have to be careful of the doggy slobber! :)
customer_reviews.author: JJ. Kohl

customer_reviews.title: Best Brush to Get the Loose Hairs Off Your Dog!!!
customer_reviews.text: This brush is amazing!!! I was at pet store (to remain nameless) looking for a brush and the sales lady said we used to carry this one call KONG ZoomGroom and it is the best brush ever she said. I thanked her and told her I would look for it on Amazon because I know they would have it. She was not kidding!!! This brush gets all the loose hairs off my dog so they don't end up all over my house. Love this brush and now using it all the time. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: BEST brush for shor hair dogs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about 1 1/2 years ago and never reviewed it! Anyway, this is the absolute best brush for short haired dogs. It is amazing how much hair comes off. It will make a mess, so brush your dogs outside. The hair doesn't stick in the brush all that well. I can't express how much I love this Zoom Groom. It still looks like new and I brush my dogs at least twice a week. I purchased the cat one too and although she doesn't love it, she doesn't hate it either. I am going to order another dog zoom groom because having a brush in each hand will make brushing much more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: workingforaliving

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a short hair dog,a pug, and a curly haired dog, got lots of hair from all of them. They all loved it. Used it as a bath brush too. Picks up hair, dirt, and small insects. It is very soft, so it can be used on short hair.
customer_reviews.author: Isaida

customer_reviews.title: love love love
customer_reviews.text: love love love!!!! half my dog is in the brush instead of my carpet! I have tried everything for these dogs ! I have a shepherd and shepherd/husky mix, when they blow their coat it is of course at the same time and we r literally swimming in the fine and long hairs all over the house. I HATE IT! I brush them everyday and this brush is the only one of the at least 10 that I tried (including the vacuum cleaner) that get that fine fuzzy undercoat and so much of it I could make sweaters out of all the hair (EWWW!) I liked Kong products before now I love them!
customer_reviews.author: SWP

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this brush for our short haired dog. We tried many brushes, and worried about scraping his skin. This one is so gentle on his skin, and works really well to remove loose hair. Very happy with this purchase. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My old basset hound loves these brushes. He no longer has eyes due to glaucoma so this brush provides great hair removal AND a massage at the same time. Plus, they are easy to clean and durable if you happen to leave them outside. I purchased two and use them at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, high quality and affordably priced dog bath product that will last a very long time. Have used it now for many months and no signs of use to be seen! Thanks =)
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: These brushes are excellent to both wash with and to groom. I have a labradoodle, and she doesn't mind being brushed with this. She also seems to love it when in the bath. I feel like I can really work the soap into a nice lather, and get it to reach her skin. It pulls out all the dead hair easily and without hurting her. I also use after the wash prior to drying. It helps pull the extra water out off of her, so drying time is reduced.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A good dog brush for bathing only
customer_reviews.text: I find that other brushes do a better job for regular brushing, but this brush is awesome for bathing. It really helps work in the soap, and it seems to help my dog enjoy bath time a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Louis C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Dog grooming brush for low hair dogs with skin allergies
customer_reviews.text: This grooming brush is prefect if you have a dog with skin allergies. This product is gently to the touch and gets the job done. No harsh scratches and marks on the dog. It helps a lot too if your dog has low hair and sheds a lot of hair. It helps with reduce hair loss, by helps clear their skin problems. Love this product! It is a must have if you have my problems with your dog.
customer_reviews.author: LRigby

customer_reviews.title: My boxer LOVES this blue grooming brush! When he ...
customer_reviews.text: My boxer LOVES this blue grooming brush! When he sees it in my hand he automatically starts to relax and lies down so I can get his side and belly!! He is just crazy about this thing as it gives the dog a massage as well as removing his excess hair. The price was very reasonable and it really does do the job of grooming! The only negative about this product is that my dog also thinks it should be a dog toy and he likes to steal this and starts chewing on it.
customer_reviews.author: GloriaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Super love this dog brush for our short-haired dogs
customer_reviews.text: Super love this dog brush for our short-haired dogs. Other than a human soft bristle brush, there is no other brushes I find work. It captures the hair and you just pull off and put in garbage. You will not regret, but unclear on long haired dogs.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this brush. It is like a magnet when brushing my dog and attracts the hair. I also use it on my clothes to remove hair. I also use it in my minivan to get the hair up. I transport alot of dogs working with a dog rescue so I always have alot of hair in the van. This brush works better than anything else I have found to remove the dog fur. Even a vacuum doesnt do as good of a job as this brush. I would recommend it to everyone, even if you do not have dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Reichelderfer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deshedding brush for short-haired breeds big and small. You can use it on dry or wet hair and works best in circular or back and forth motions. Super easy to spray off to clean as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany M

customer_reviews.title: WOW I love this! I have an amstaff who has the ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW I love this! I have an amstaff who has the straw-type hair so a lot of brushes don’t work very well on her hair. This works so well! I recommend brushing your dog outside with it if because it just lifts the hair out of the coat and then you can just use your hand to brush it off of their back. It lifts SO MUCH hair out of her coat and she loves when we brush her with it!
customer_reviews.author: Bladison

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: One of the best brushes, most versitile, and well made. Good for shorter, thinner, abd smoother coats. In the tub to work in shampoo and conditioner right to the skin, and also dry to revove extra hair. Great for bulldogs, boxers, mastifs, danes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Silly but Really Useful
customer_reviews.text: I've had this brush a few years. It's very handy. My dog has short-medium length straight hair. I use a rake (dog brush with stiff tines, resembles a garden rake) first to take out burrs, tangles, etc. Then I use the Kong brush. It removes a lot of the loose fur (she sheds a lot). It's also great for bathing her--shampooing and scrubbing in the soap. And after a bath, it's clean and looks like new again. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. My dog will let me brush him with it for a half an hour, because the nubs are soft and massaging. It's amazingly easy to clean and is SUPER effective, especially if the dog's fur is slightly damp, as it sticks right to the brush. (I use a coat spray before brushing)
customer_reviews.author: Michaela Callahan

customer_reviews.title: my dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: It works really great to get any loose fur off of my chinese crested powderpuff but we don't have any problem with him shedding to begin with. It helps to cut down on the shedding for my beagle mix and she loves to be pet with it, but most of her fur doesn't stick to the brush and the first time I used it there was hair all of the couch where i brushed her.. It definitely helps to have something nearby to put the hair on like a paper towel or just have a trash can near by.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Putnam

product_meta.title: KONG ZoomGroom, Dog Grooming Toy
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe KONG ZoomGroom is the best grooming and shampooing brush available. It removes loose hair like a magnet, and it stimulates capillaries and natural oil production for healthy skin and a healthy coat. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: It removes loose hair like a magnet, and it stimulates capillaries and natural oil production for healthy skin and a healthy coat.
Perfect for removing hair and use with shampoo
Comes in two colors: raspberry and boysenberry
Available in two sizes: small/puppy and regular
